DefaultCookiesSetting.title: Default cookies setting
DefaultCookiesSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to set local data. Setting local data can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

enum_titles: Allow all sites to set local data
Do not allow any site to set local data
Keep cookies for the duration of the session

BlockThirdPartyCookies.title: Block third party cookies
BlockThirdPartyCookies.description: Enabling this setting prevents cookies from being set by web page elements that are not from the domain that is in the browser's address bar.

CookiesAllowedForUrls.title: Allow cookies on these sites
CookiesAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to set cookies.

CookiesBlockedForUrls.title: Block cookies on these sites
CookiesBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to set cookies.

CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.title: Limit cookies from matching URLs to the current session
CookiesSessionOnlyForUrls.description: Cookies set by pages matching these URL patterns will be limited to the current session, i.e. they will be deleted when the browser exits.

DefaultImagesSetting.title: Default images setting
DefaultImagesSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to display images. Displaying images can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

enum_titles: Allow all sites to show all images
Do not allow any site to show images

DefaultInsecureContentSetting.title: Default insecure content setting
DefaultInsecureContentSetting.description: Control use of insecure content exceptions

enum_titles: Do not allow any site to load blockable mixed content
Allow users to add exceptions to allow blockable mixed content

InsecureContentAllowedForUrls.description: List of URLs to allow insecure content

InsecureContentBlockedForUrls.description: List of URLs to block insecure content

DefaultJavaScriptSetting.title: Default JavaScript setting
DefaultJavaScriptSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to run JavaScript. Running JavaScript can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

enum_titles: Allow all sites to run JavaScript
Do not allow any site to run JavaScript

DefaultPluginsSetting.title: Default Flash setting
DefaultPluginsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to automatically run the Flash plugin. Automatically running the Flash plugin can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

enum_titles: Allow all sites to automatically run the Flash plugin

DefaultPopupsSetting.title: Default popups setting
DefaultPopupsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to show pop-ups. Showing popups can be either allowed for all websites or denied for all websites.

enum_titles: Allow all sites to show pop-ups
Do not allow any site to show popups

DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.title: Control use of the Web Bluetooth API
DefaultWebBluetoothGuardSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to get access to nearby Bluetooth devices. Access can be completely blocked, or the user can be asked every time a website wants to get access to nearby Bluetooth devices.

enum_titles: Do not allow any site to request access to Bluetooth devices via the Web Bluetooth API
Allow sites to ask the user to grant access to a nearby Bluetooth device

DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.title: Control use of the WebUSB API
DefaultWebUsbGuardSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to get access to connected USB devices. Access can be completely blocked, or the user can be asked every time a website wants to get access to connected USB devices.

enum_titles: Do not allow any site to request access to USB devices via the WebUSB API
Allow sites to ask the user to grant access to a connected USB device

ImagesAllowedForUrls.title: Allow images on these sites
ImagesAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to display images.

ImagesBlockedForUrls.title: Block images on these sites
ImagesBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to display images.

JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.title: Allow JavaScript on these sites
JavaScriptAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run JavaScript.

JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.title: Block JavaScript on these sites
JavaScriptBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run JavaScript.

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.title: Legacy SameSite cookie behavior
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabled.description: Enable default legacy SameSite cookie behavior setting

enum_titles: Revert to legacy SameSite behavior for cookies on all sites
Use SameSite-by-default behavior for cookies on all sites

LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.title: Legacy SameSite cookie allowed list
LegacySameSiteCookieBehaviorEnabledForDo.description: Revert to legacy SameSite behavior for cookies on specified sites

PluginsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PluginsBlockedForUrls.title: Block the Flash plugin on these sites
PluginsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to run the Flash plugin.

PopupsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow popups on these sites
PopupsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to open popups.

PopupsBlockedForUrls.title: Block popups on these sites
PopupsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are not allowed to open popups.

AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.title: Automatically select client certificates for these sites
AutoSelectCertificateForUrls.description: Allows you to specify a list of url patterns that specify sites for which Google Chrome should automatically select a client certificate, if the site requests a certificate.

DefaultGeolocationSetting.title: Default geolocation setting
DefaultGeolocationSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to track the users' physical location. Tracking the users' physical location can be allowed by default, denied by default or the user can be asked every time a website requests the physical location.

enum_titles: Allow sites to track the users' physical location
Do not allow any site to track the users' physical location
Ask whenever a site wants to track the users' physical location

RegisteredProtocolHandlers.title: Register protocol handlers
RegisteredProtocolHandlers.description: Allows you to register a list of protocol handlers. This can only be a recommended policy. The property |protocol| should be set to the scheme such as 'mailto' and the property |url| should be set to the URL pattern of the application that handles the scheme. The pattern can include a '%s', which if present will be replaced by the handled URL.

WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.title: Automatically grant permission to these sites to connect to USB devices with the given vendor and product IDs
WebUsbAllowDevicesForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of urls that specify which sites will automatically be granted permission to access a USB device with the given vendor and product IDs.

AutoplayAllowed.title: Allow media autoplay
AutoplayAllowed.description: Allows you to control if videos can play automatically (without user consent) with audio content in Google Chrome.

BackgroundModeEnabled.title: Enable background mode
BackgroundModeEnabled.description: Continue running background apps after Microsoft Edge closes.

BackgroundTemplateListUpdatesEnabled.title: Enable background updates for templates
BackgroundTemplateListUpdatesEnabled.description: If you enable this setting or the setting is unconfigured, the list of available templates will be downloaded in the background from a Microsoft service every 24 hours.

BingAdsSuppression.title: Suppress Bing Ads
BingAdsSuppression.description: Block all ads on Bing search results.

DefaultNotificationsSetting.title: Default notification setting
DefaultNotificationsSetting.description: Allows you to set whether websites are allowed to display desktop notifications. Displaying desktop notifications can be allowed by default, denied by default or the user can be asked every time a website wants to show desktop notifications.

enum_titles: Allow sites to show desktop notifications
Do not allow any site to show desktop notifications
Ask every time a site wants to show desktop notifications

NotificationsAllowedForUrls.title: Allow notifications on these sites
NotificationsAllowedForUrls.description: Allows you to create a list of url patterns to specify sites that are allowed to display notifications.

NotificationsBlockedForUrls.title: Block notifications on these sites
NotificationsBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to create a list of url patterns to specify sites that are not allowed to display notifications.

DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.title: Enable the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderEnabled.description: Enables the use of a default search provider.

DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.title: Default search provider encodings
DefaultSearchProviderEncodings.description: Specifies the character encodings supported by the search provider. Encodings are code page names like UTF-8, GB2312, and ISO-8859-1. They are tried in the order provided.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.title: Parameter providing search-by-image feature for the default search provider
DefaultSearchProviderImageURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used to provide image search. Search requests will be sent using the GET method. If the DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams policy is set then image search requests will use the POST method instead.

DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.title: Parameters for image URL which uses POST
DefaultSearchProviderImageURLPostParams.description: Specifies the parameters used when doing image search with POST. It consists of comma-separated name/value pairs. If a value is a template parameter, like {imageThumbnail} in above example, it will be replaced with real image thumbnail data.

DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.title: Default search provider keyword
DefaultSearchProviderKeyword.description: Specifies the keyword, which is the shortcut used in the omnibox to trigger the search for this provider.

DefaultSearchProviderName.title: Default search provider name
DefaultSearchProviderName.description: Specifies the name of the default search provider. If left empty or not set, the host name specified by the search URL will be used.

DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.title: Default search provider search URL
DefaultSearchProviderSearchURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used when doing a default search. The URL should contain the string '{searchTerms}', which will be replaced at query time by the terms the user is searching for.

DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.title: Default search provider suggest URL
DefaultSearchProviderSuggestURL.description: Specifies the URL of the search engine used to provide search suggestions. The URL should contain the string '{searchTerms}', which will be replaced at query time by the text the user has entered so far.

ExtensionAllowedTypes.title: Types of extensions/apps that are allowed to be installed
ExtensionAllowedTypes.description: Controls which app/extension types are allowed to be installed and limits runtime access.

ExtensionInstallSources.title: URL patterns to allow extension, app, and user script installs from
ExtensionInstallSources.description: Allows you to specify which URLs are allowed to install extensions, apps, and themes.

ExtensionInstallBlocklist.title: Extension IDs the user should be prevented from installing (or * for all)
ExtensionInstallBlocklist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions the users can NOT install. Extensions already installed will be disabled if denied, without a way for the user to enable them. Once an extension is disabled due to the denylist being removed, it will automatically get re-enabled.

ExtensionInstallAllowlist.title: Extension ID Allowlist
ExtensionInstallAllowlist.description: Allows you to specify which extensions are not subject to the denylist.

ExtensionInstallForcelist.title: Extension/App IDs and update URLs to be silently installed
ExtensionInstallForcelist.description: Specifies a list of apps and extensions that are installed silently, without user interaction, and which cannot be uninstalled nor disabled by the user. All permissions requested by the apps/extensions are granted implicitly, without user interaction, including any additional permissions requested by future versions of the app/extension. Furthermore, permissions are granted for the enterprise.deviceAttributes and enterprise.platformKeys extension APIs. (These two APIs are not available to apps/extensions that are not force-installed.)

ExtensionSettings.title: Extension management settings
ExtensionSettings.description: Configures extension management settings for Google Chrome. A default configuration can be set for the special ID "*"

installation_mode.description: Maps to a string indicating the installation mode for the extension.

update_url.description: Maps to a string indicating where Chrome can download a force_installed or normal_installed extension.

blocked_permissions.description: Maps to a list of strings indicating the blocked API permissions for the extension.

install_sources.description: Each item in this list is an extension-style match pattern.

allowed_types.description: This setting sets the allowed types of extension/apps that can be installed in Google Chrome.

blocked_install_message.description: This maps to a string specifying the error message to display to users if they're blocked from installing an extension.

runtime_blocked_hosts.description: Maps to a list of strings representing hosts whose webpages the extension will be blocked from modifying.

runtime_allowed_hosts.description: Maps to a list of strings representing hosts that an extension can interact with regardless of whether they are listed in "runtime_blocked_hosts".

EnableMediaRouter.title: Enable Google Cast
EnableMediaRouter.description: If this policy is set to true or is not set, Google Cast will be enabled, and users will be able to launch it from the app menu, page context menus, media controls on Cast-enabled websites, and (if shown) the Cast toolbar icon.

ShowCastIconInToolbar.title: Show the Google Cast toolbar icon
ShowCastIconInToolbar.description: If this policy is set to true, the Cast toolbar icon will always be shown on the toolbar or the overflow menu, and users will not be able to remove it.

AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.title: Cross-origin HTTP Basic Auth prompts
AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.description: Controls whether third-party sub-content on a page is allowed to pop-up an HTTP Basic Auth dialog box.

AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.title: Kerberos delegation server allowlist
AuthNegotiateDelegateAllowlist.description: Servers that Microsoft Edge may delegate to.

AuthSchemes.title: Supported authentication schemes
AuthSchemes.description: Specifies which HTTP authentication schemes are supported by Microsoft Edge. Possible values are 'basic', 'digest', 'ntlm' and 'negotiate'. Separate multiple values with commas.

AuthServerAllowlist.title: Authentication server allowlist
AuthServerAllowlist.description: Specifies which servers should be allowed for integrated authentication. Integrated authentication is only enabled when Microsoft Edge receives an authentication challenge from a proxy or from a server which is in this permitted list.

DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.title: Disable CNAME lookup when negotiating Kerberos authentication
DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN is based on the canonical DNS name or the original name entered.

EnableAuthNegotiatePort.title: Include non-standard port in Kerberos SPN
EnableAuthNegotiatePort.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN should include a non-standard port.

NtlmV2Enabled.title: Enable NTLMv2 authentication
NtlmV2Enabled.description: If you don't configure this policy, NTLMv2 is enabled by default.

AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.title: Ads setting for sites with intrusive ads
AdsSettingForIntrusiveAdsSites.description: Allows you to set whether ads should be blocked on sites with intrusive ads.

enum_titles: Do not allow ads on sites with intrusive ads

AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.title: Enable deleting browser and download history
AllowDeletingBrowserHistory.description: Enables deleting browser history and download history in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing this setting.

AllowFileSelectionDialogs.title: Allow invocation of file selection dialogs
AllowFileSelectionDialogs.description: Allows access to local files on the machine by allowing Microsoft Edge to display file selection dialogs.

AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.title: Allow a page to show popups during its unloading
AllowPopupsDuringPageUnload.description: This policy allows an admin to specify that a page may show popups during its unloading.

AllowSurfGame.title: Allow Surf Game
AllowSurfGame.description: Enables or disables the built-in surf game. Game accessible via edge://surf.

AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.title: Allow pages to send synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal
AllowSyncXHRInPageDismissal.description: This policy lets you specify that a page can send synchronous XHR requests during page dismissal.

AllowTrackingForUrls.title: Configure tracking prevention exceptions for specific sites
AllowTrackingForUrls.description: Configure the list of URL patterns that are excluded from tracking prevention.

AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.title: Enable alternate error pages
AlternateErrorPagesEnabled.description: Enables the use of alternate error pages that are built into Microsoft Edge (such as 'page not found') and prevents users from changing this setting.

AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.title: Always Open PDF files externally
AlwaysOpenPdfExternally.description: Disables the internal PDF viewer in Microsoft Edge. Instead it treats it as download and allows the user to open PDF files with the default application.

AppCacheForceEnabled.title: Force Enable AppCache
AppCacheForceEnabled.description: Allows the AppCache feature to be re-enabled, even if it's turned off by default

AudioCaptureAllowed.title: Allow or deny audio capture
AudioCaptureAllowed.description: If enabled or not configured (default), the user will be prompted for audio capture access except for URLs configured in the AudioCaptureAllowedUrls list which will be granted access without prompting.

AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.title: URLs that will be granted access to audio capture devices without prompt
AudioCaptureAllowedUrls.description:
Patterns in this list will be matched against the security
origin of the requesting URL.  If a match is found, access to audio
capture devices will be granted without prompt.

AutoImportAtFirstRun.title: Automatically import browser data and settings at first run
AutoImportAtFirstRun.description: If you enable this policy, Microsoft Edge automatically imports all supported datatypes and settings from either the default browser or another specified browser. This also forces Microsoft Edge to skip the import section of the first-run experience.

enum_titles: Import all supported datatypes and settings from the default browser
Import all supported datatypes and settings from Google Chrome
Import all supported datatypes and settings from Safari
Disable automatic import & skip import section of the first-run experience

AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.title: Allowed URLs for Auto Open
AutoOpenAllowedForURLs.description: URLs where AutoOpenFileTypes can apply. If you set URLs in this policy, files will only automatically open by policy if the URL is part of this set and the file type is listed in AutoOpenFileTypes. If either condition is false, the download won't automatically open by policy.

AutoOpenFileTypes.title: Auto Open File Types
AutoOpenFileTypes.description: List of file types that should be automatically opened on download. Note: The leading separator should not be included when listing the file type, so list "txt" instead of ".txt".

AutofillAddressEnabled.title: Enable AutoFill for addresses
AutofillAddressEnabled.description: Enables Microsoft Edge's AutoFill feature and allows users to auto complete address information in web forms using previously stored information.

AutofillCreditCardEnabled.title: Enable AutoFill for credit cards
AutofillCreditCardEnabled.description: Enables Microsoft Edge's AutoFill feature and allows users to auto complete credit card information in web forms using previously stored information.

FavoritesBarEnabled.title: Enable Bookmark Bar
FavoritesBarEnabled.description: If you enable this setting, Microsoft Edge will show a bookmark bar.

BrowserAddProfileEnabled.title: Enable add person in user manager
BrowserAddProfileEnabled.description: Enable profile creation from the Identity flyout menu or the Settings page

BrowserGuestModeEnabled.title: Enable guest mode in browser
BrowserGuestModeEnabled.description: Enable the option to allow the use of guest profiles in Microsoft Edge. In a guest profile, the browser doesn't import browsing data from existing profiles, and it deletes browsing data when all guest profiles are closed.

BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.title: Allow queries to a network time service
BrowserNetworkTimeQueriesEnabled.description: If set to false, prevents Microsoft Edge from occasionally sending queries to a browser network time service to retrieve an accurate timestamp.

BrowserSignin.title: Browser Signin
BrowserSignin.description: Specify whether a user can sign into Microsoft Edge with their account and use account-related services like sync and single sign on.

enum_titles: Force users to sign-in to use the browser

BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.title: Use built-in certificate verifier
BuiltinCertificateVerifierEnabled.description: Determines whether the built-in certificate verifier will be used to verify server certificates.

BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.title: Use built-in DNS client
BuiltInDnsClientEnabled.description: Controls whether to use the built-in DNS client.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of Legacy Certificate Authorities
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements for a list of Legacy Certificate Authorities.

CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.title: Disable Certificate Transparency enforcement for a list of URLs
CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabl.description: Disables enforcing Certificate Transparency requirements to the listed URLs. Form your URL pattern according to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322

ClearBrowsingDataOnExit.title: Clear browsing data when Microsoft Edge closes
ClearBrowsingDataOnExit.description: If you enable this policy, all browsing data is deleted each time Microsoft Edge closes.

ClearCachedImagesAndFilesOnExit.title: Clear cached images and files when Edge quits
ClearCachedImagesAndFilesOnExit.description: Clear cached images and files when Microsoft Edge closes.

CollectionsServicesAndExportsBlockList.title: Services and Export Collection Blocklist
CollectionsServicesAndExportsBlockList.description: Block user access to a specified list of services and export targets in Collections. This includes displaying additional data from Bing and exporting collections to Microsoft products or external partners.

CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.title: Command Line Flag Security Warnings Enabled
CommandLineFlagSecurityWarningsEnabled.description: If disabled, prevents security warnings from appearing when Edge is launched with some potentially dangerous command-line flags.

ComponentUpdatesEnabled.title: Edge component updates
ComponentUpdatesEnabled.description: Enables component updates for all components in Microsoft Edge when not set or set to True.

ConfigureDoNotTrack.title: Configure Do Not Track
ConfigureDoNotTrack.description: Specify whether to send Do Not Track requests to websites that ask for tracking info.

ConfigureOnlineTextToSpeech.title: Configure Online Text To Speech
ConfigureOnlineTextToSpeech.description: If you enable or don't configure this policy, web-based applications that use the SpeechSynthesis API can use Online Text to Speech voice fonts.

CustomHelpLink.title: Specify custom help link
CustomHelpLink.description: Specify a link for the Help menu or the F1 key.

DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.title: DNS interception checks enabled
DNSInterceptionChecksEnabled.description: This policy configures a local switch that can be used to disable DNS interception checks. These checks attempt to discover whether the browser is behind a proxy that redirects unknown host names.

DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.title: Set Microsoft Edge as Default Browser
DefaultBrowserSettingEnabled.description: Configures the default browser checks in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing them. If set to true, Edge will always checks on startup whether it is the default browser and automatically registers itself, if possible.

DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.title: Allow Default Search Provider on Context Menu
DefaultSearchProviderContextMenuAccessAl.description: Allow default search provider context menu search access

DeveloperToolsAvailability.title: Control where Developer Tools can be used
DeveloperToolsAvailability.description: Allows you to control where Developer Tools can be used.

enum_titles: Disallow usage of the Developer Tools on extensions installed by enterprise policy, allow usage of the Developer Tools in other contexts
Allow usage of the Developer Tools
Disallow usage of the Developer Tools

DiagnosticData.title: Send Edge Browser Diagnostic Data
DiagnosticData.description: Send required and optional diagnostic data about browser usage. 'RequiredData' sends required diagnostic data but turns off optional diagnostic data collection. Microsoft Edge will send required diagnostic data to keep Microsoft Edge secure, up to date and performing as expected. 'OptionalData' sends optional diagnostic data includes data about browser usage, websites that are visited, crash reports sent to Microsoft for product and service improvement.

Disable3DAPIs.title: Disable support for 3D graphics APIs
Disable3DAPIs.description: Enabling this setting prevents web pages from accessing the graphics processing unit (GPU). Specifically, web pages can not access the WebGL API and plugins can not use the Pepper 3D API.

DisableScreenshots.title: Disable taking screenshots
DisableScreenshots.description: If enabled, screenshots cannot be taken using keyboard shortcuts or extension APIs.

DiskCacheDir.title: Set disk cache directory
DiskCacheDir.description: Configures the directory that Microsoft Edge will use for storing cached files on the disk. See https://www.chromium.org/administrators/policy-list-3/user-data-directory-variables for a list of variables that can be used. To avoid data loss or other unexpected errors this policy should not be set to a volume's root directory or to a directory used for other purposes, because Edge manages its contents

DiskCacheSize.title: Set disk cache size
DiskCacheSize.description: Configures the cache size that Microsoft Edge will use for storing cached files on the disk. The value specified in this policy is not a hard boundary but rather a suggestion to the caching system, any value below a few megabytes is too small and will be rounded up to a sane minimum. If the value of this policy is 0, the default cache size will be used but the user will not be able to change it.

DownloadDirectory.title: Set download directory
DownloadDirectory.description:
Configures the directory that Microsoft Edge will use for downloading files. If you set this policy, Edge will use the provided directory regardless whether the user has specified one or enabled the flag to be prompted for download location every time. If this policy is left not set the default download directory will be used and the user will be able to change it.

See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095041 for a list of variables that can be used.

DownloadRestrictions.title: Download restrictions
DownloadRestrictions.description: Configures the type of downloads that Microsoft Edge will completely block, without letting users override the security decision.

EdgeCollectionsEnabled.title: Enable the Collections feature
EdgeCollectionsEnabled.description: Lets you allow users to access the Collections feature, where they can collect, organize, share, and export content more efficiently and with Office integration.

EditFavoritesEnabled.title: Enable or disable favorites editing
EditFavoritesEnabled.description: If you enable this setting, favorites can be added, removed or modified. This is the default also when this policy is not set.

EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.title: Enable deprecated web platform features for a limited time
EnableDeprecatedWebPlatformFeatures.description:
ExampleDeprecatedFeature_EffectiveUntil20080902 - Enable ExampleDeprecatedFeature API through 2008/09/02
Specify a list of deprecated web platform features to re-enable temporarily.

EnableDomainActionsDownload.title: Enable Domain Actions Download from Microsoft
EnableDomainActionsDownload.description: If you enable this policy, the list of Domain Actions will continue to be downloaded from the Experimentation and Configuration Service.

EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.title: Whether online OCSP/CRL checks are performed
EnableOnlineRevocationChecks.description: In light of the fact that soft-fail, online revocation checks provide no effective security benefit, they are disabled by default in Google Chrome version 19 and later. By setting this policy to true, the previous behavior is restored and online OCSP/CRL checks will be performed.

EnableSha1ForLocalAnchors.title: Enable SHA-1 for Local Anchors
EnableSha1ForLocalAnchors.description: Allow certificates signed using SHA-1 when issued by local trust anchors (deprecated).

EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.title: Enable Managed Extensions to use the Enterprise Hardware API
EnterpriseHardwarePlatformAPIEnabled.description: When this policy is set to enabled, extensions installed by enterprise policy are allowed to use the Enterprise Hardware Platform API.

ExperimentationAndConfigurationServiceCo.title: Control Experimentation and Configuration Service
ExperimentationAndConfigurationServiceCo.description: Control communication with the Experimentation and Configuration Service

enum_titles: Disable communication with the Experimentation and Configuration Service

ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.title: Show an "Always open" checkbox in external protocol dialog
ExternalProtocolDialogShowAlwaysOpenChec.description: If you set to True, when an external protocol confirmation prompt is shown, the user can select "Always open". The user won’t get any future confirmation prompts for this protocol.

ForceEphemeralProfiles.title: Ephemeral profile
ForceEphemeralProfiles.description: If set to enabled this policy forces the profile to be switched to ephemeral mode. If this policy is specified as an OS policy (e.g. GPO on Windows) it will apply to every profile on the system; if the policy is set as a Cloud policy it will apply only to a profile signed in with a managed account.

ForceBingSafeSearch.title: Force Bing SafeSearch
ForceBingSafeSearch.description: Forces queries in Google Web Search to be done with SafeSearch set to active and prevents users from changing this setting.

enum_titles: Don't configure search restrictions in Bing
Configure moderate search restrictions in Bing
Configure strict search restrictions in Bing

ForceCertificatePromptsOnMultipleMatches.title: Force Certificate Prompt on Multiple Matches
ForceCertificatePromptsOnMultipleMatches.description: Configure whether Microsoft Edge should automatically select a certificate when there are multiple certificate matches for a site configured with "AutoSelectCertificateForUrls" (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-policies#autoselectcertificateforurls).

ForceGoogleSafeSearch.title: Force Google SafeSearch
ForceGoogleSafeSearch.description: Forces queries in Google Web Search to be done with SafeSearch set to active and prevents users from changing this setting.

ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.title: Force Legacy Default Referrer Policy
ForceLegacyDefaultReferrerPolicy.description: Use a default referrer policy of no-referrer-when-downgrade.

ForceYouTubeRestrict.title: Force minimum YouTube Restricted Mode
ForceYouTubeRestrict.description: Enforces a minimum Restricted Mode on YouTube and prevents users from picking a less restricted mode.

enum_titles: Do not enforce Restricted Mode on YouTube
Enforce at least Moderate Restricted Mode on YouTube
Enforce Strict Restricted Mode for YouTube

GoToIntranetSiteForSingleWordEntryInAddr.title: Force direct intranet site navigation instead of searching on single word entries in the Address Bar
GoToIntranetSiteForSingleWordEntryInAddr.description: If you enable this policy, the top auto-suggest result in the address bar suggestion list will navigate to intranet sites if the text entered in the address bar is a single word without punctuation.

HSTSPolicyBypassList.title: Configure the list of names that will bypass the HSTS policy check
HSTSPolicyBypassList.description: Hostnames specified in this list will be exempt from the HSTS policy check that could potentially upgrade requests from "http://" to "https://". Only single-label hostnames are allowed in this policy.

HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.title: Use hardware acceleration when available
HardwareAccelerationModeEnabled.description: If this policy is set to true or left unset, hardware acceleration will be enabled unless a certain GPU feature is on the denylist.

HideFirstRunExperience.title: Hide the First-run experience and splash screen
HideFirstRunExperience.description: If you enable this policy, the First-run experience and the splash screen will not be shown to users when they run Microsoft Edge for the first time.

ImportAutofillFormData.title: Import autofill form data from default browser on first run
ImportAutofillFormData.description: This policy forces the autofill form data to be imported from the previous default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportBrowserSettings.title: Allow importing of browser settings
ImportBrowserSettings.description: Allows users to import browser settings from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportFavorites.title: Import Favorites from default browser on first run
ImportFavorites.description: This policy forces bookmarks to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportHistory.title: Import browsing history from default browser on first run
ImportHistory.description: This policy forces the browsing history to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportHomepage.title: Import of homepage from default browser on first run
ImportHomepage.description: This policy forces the home page to be imported from the current default browser if enabled.

ImportOpenTabs.title: Allow importing of open tabs
ImportOpenTabs.description: Allows users to import open and pinned tabs from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportPaymentInfo.title: Allow importing of payment info
ImportPaymentInfo.description: Allows users to import payment info from another browser into Microsoft Edge.

ImportSavedPasswords.title: Import saved passwords from default browser on first run
ImportSavedPasswords.description: This policy forces the saved passwords to be imported from the previous default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

ImportSearchEngine.title: Import search engines from default browser on first run
ImportSearchEngine.description: This policy forces search engines to be imported from the current default browser if enabled. If enabled, this policy also affects the import dialog.

InPrivateModeAvailability.title: Private mode availability
InPrivateModeAvailability.description: Specifies whether the user may open pages in Private mode in Microsoft Edge.

IsolateOrigins.title: Enable Site Isolation for specified origins
IsolateOrigins.description: Specify origins to run in isolation, in their own process. This policy also isolates origins named by subdomains - for example, specifying https://contoso.com/ will cause https://foo.contoso.com/ to be isolated as part of the https://contoso.com/ site. If the policy is enabled, each of the named origins in a comma-separated list will run in its own process. If you disable this policy, then both the 'IsolateOrigins' and 'SitePerProcess' features are disabled. Users can still enable 'IsolateOrigins' policy manually, via command line flags. If you don't configure the policy, the user can change this setting.

items.title: Managed Favorites Folder Name
items.description: The top-level managed favorites folder name.

ManagedFavorites.title: Managed Favorites
ManagedFavorites.description: Configures a list of managed bookmarks.

NewTabPageSearchBox.title: New Tab Page Search Box
NewTabPageSearchBox.description: Configure the new tab page search box experience. You can configure the new tab page search box to use "Search box (Recommended)" or "Address bar" to search on new tabs.

MaxConnectionsPerProxy.title: Maximal number of concurrent connections to the proxy server
MaxConnectionsPerProxy.description: Specifies the maximal number of simultaneous connections to the proxy server.

MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.title: Allow Google Cast to connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses.
MediaRouterCastAllowAllIPs.description: If this policy is set to true, Google Cast will connect to Cast devices on all IP addresses, not just RFC1918/RFC4913 private addresses.

MetricsReportingEnabled.title: Enable reporting of usage and crash-related data
MetricsReportingEnabled.description: Enables anonymous reporting of usage and crash-related data about Microsoft Edge to Microsoft and prevents users from changing this setting.

OmniboxMSBProviderEnabled.title: Enable Microsoft Search for Business provider in omnibox
OmniboxMSBProviderEnabled.description: Enables the display of relevant MSB suggestions in omnibox when user types a search string in the addressbar

PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.title: Allow websites to query for available payment methods
PaymentMethodQueryEnabled.description: Allows you to set whether websites can check if the user has payment methods saved.

PersonalizationReportingEnabled.title: Allow personalization of ads, search and news by sending browsing history to Microsoft
PersonalizationReportingEnabled.description: This policy prevents Microsoft from collecting a user's Microsoft Edge browsing history to be used for personalizing advertising, search, news and other Microsoft services.

ProactiveAuthEnabled.title: Enable Proactive Authentication
ProactiveAuthEnabled.description: Lets you configure whether to turn on Proactive Authentication.

NetworkPredictionOptions.title: Enable network prediction
NetworkPredictionOptions.description: Enables network prediction and prevents users from changing this setting. This controls DNS prefetching, TCP and SSL preconnection, and prerendering of web pages.

enum_titles: Predict network actions on any network connection
Do not predict network actions on any network connection

OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.title: Origins or hostname patterns to be treated as secure context
OverrideSecurityRestrictionsOnInsecureOr.description:
The policy specifies a list of origins (URLs) or hostname patterns (such as "*.example.com") to be treated as secure contexts. The intent is to allow organizations to set up a staging server for internal web development, so that their developers can test out features requiring secure contexts without having to deploy TLS on the staging server.

Setting a list of URLs in this policy has the same effect as setting the command-line flag '--unsafely-treat-insecure-origin-as-secure' to a comma-separated list of the same URLs. If the policy is set, it will override the command-line flag.

For more information on secure contexts, see https://www.w3.org/TR/secure-contexts/

PromotionalTabsEnabled.title: Enable showing full-tab promotional content
PromotionalTabsEnabled.description: Allows you to control the presentation of full-tab promotional and/or educational content in Microsoft Edge.

PromptForDownloadLocation.title: Ask where to save each file before downloading
PromptForDownloadLocation.description:
If the policy is enabled, the user will be asked where to save each file before downloading.
If the policy is disabled, downloads will start immediately, and the user will not be asked where to save the file.
If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting.

ProxySettings.title: Proxy Settings
ProxySettings.description:
Configures the proxy settings for Google Chrome. These proxy settings will be available for ARC-apps too.

If you enable this setting, Google Chrome and ARC-apps ignore all proxy-related options specified from the command line.

QuicAllowed.title: Allow QUIC protocol
QuicAllowed.description: QUIC is a transport layer network protocol that can improve performance of web applications that currently use TCP.

RelaunchNotification.title: Notify a user that a browser relaunch is recommended or required
RelaunchNotification.description: Notify users that Microsoft Edge must be relaunched to apply a pending update.

enum_titles: Show a recurring prompt to the user indicating that a relaunch is recommended
Show a recurring prompt to the user indicating that a relaunch is required

RelaunchNotificationPeriod.title: Update time period
RelaunchNotificationPeriod.description: Allows you to set the time period, in milliseconds, over which users are notified that Microsoft Edge must be relaunched to apply a pending update.

ResolveNavigationErrorsUseWebService.title: Enable resolution of navigation errors using a web service
ResolveNavigationErrorsUseWebService.description: Allow Microsoft Edge to issue a dataless connection to a web service to probe networks for connectivity in cases like hotel and airport Wi-Fi.

RestrictSigninToPattern.title: Restrict which users are allowed to sign in to Google Chrome
RestrictSigninToPattern.description: Determines which accounts can be set as browser primary accounts in Microsoft Edge (the account that is chosen during the Sync opt-in flow)

RunAllFlashInAllowMode.title: Extend Flash content setting to all content
RunAllFlashInAllowMode.description: If you enable this setting, all Flash content embedded on websites that have been set to allow Flash in content settings -- either by the user or by enterprise policy -- will be run, including content from other origins or small content.

SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.title: Allow proceeding from the SSL warning page
SSLErrorOverrideAllowed.description:
Edge shows a warning page when users navigate to sites that have SSL errors. By default or when this policy is set to true, users are allowed to click through these warning pages.
Setting this policy to false disallows users to click through any warning page.

SSLVersionMin.title: Minimum SSL version enabled
SSLVersionMin.description: If this policy is not configured then Microsoft Edge uses a default minimum version which is TLS 1.0.

SaveCookiesOnExit.title: Save Cookies on Exit
SaveCookiesOnExit.description: Save cookies when Microsoft Edge closes. When this policy is enabled, the specified set of cookies is exempt from deletion when the browser closes.

SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.title: Disable saving browser history
SavingBrowserHistoryDisabled.description: Disables saving browser history in Microsft Edge and prevents users from changing this setting.

SearchSuggestEnabled.title: Enable search suggestions
SearchSuggestEnabled.description: Enables search suggestions in Microsoft Edge's omnibox and prevents users from changing this setting.

SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.title: URLs/domains automatically permitted direct Security Key attestation
SecurityKeyPermitAttestation.description: Specifies URLs and domains for which no prompt will be shown when attestation certificates from Security Keys are requested. Additionally, a signal will be sent to the Security Key indicating that individual attestation may be used. Without this, users will be prompted in Chrome 65+ when sites request attestation of Security Keys.

SendSiteInfoToImproveServices.title: Send site information to improve Microsoft services
SendSiteInfoToImproveServices.description: This policy enables sending info about websites visited in Microsoft Edge to Microsoft to improve services like search.

ShowOfficeShortcutInFavoritesBar.title: Show Microsoft Office shortcut in favorites bar
ShowOfficeShortcutInFavoritesBar.description: Specifies whether to include a shortcut to Office.com in the favorites bar. For users signed into Microsoft Edge the shortcut takes users to their Microsoft Office apps and docs.

SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.title: Enabled Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG) support
SignedHTTPExchangeEnabled.description: Enable support for Signed HTTP Exchange (SXG).

SitePerProcess.title: Enable Site Isolation for every site
SitePerProcess.description: You might want to look at the IsolateOrigins policy setting to get the best of both worlds, isolation and limited impact for users, by using IsolateOrigins with a list of the sites you want to isolate. This setting, SitePerProcess, isolates all sites. If the policy is enabled, each site will run in its own process. If the policy is disabled, no explicit Site Isolation will happen and field trials of IsolateOrigins and SitePerProcess will be disabled. Users will still be able to enable SitePerProcess manually. If the policy is not configured, the user will be able to change this setting. On Google Chrome OS, it is recommended to also set the DeviceLoginScreenSitePerProcess device policy to the same value. If the values specified by the two policies don't match, a delay may be incurred when entering a user session while the value specified by user policy is being applied.

SpellcheckEnabled.title: Enable spellcheck
SpellcheckEnabled.description: If this policy is not set or enabled, the user is allowed to use spellcheck.

StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.title: Enable stricter mixed content treatment
StricterMixedContentTreatmentEnabled.description: Enable stricter treatment for mixed content.

SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.title: Suppress the unsupported OS warning
SuppressUnsupportedOSWarning.description: Suppresses the warning that appears when Microsoft Edge is running on a computer or operating system that is no longer supported.

SyncDisabled.title: Disable synchronization of data with Google
SyncDisabled.description: Disables data synchronization in Google Chrome using Google-hosted synchronization services and prevents users from changing this setting.

SyncTypesListDisabled.title: Disable synchronization of selected data types
SyncTypesListDisabled.description: Configure the list of types that are excluded from synchronization.

TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.title: Enable TLS 1.3 Hardening
TLS13HardeningForLocalAnchorsEnabled.description: Enable a TLS 1.3 security feature for local trust anchors

TLSCipherSuiteDenyList.title: TLS Cipher Suite Deny List
TLSCipherSuiteDenyList.description: Specify the TLS cipher suites to disable. If you don't configure this policy, the browser will choose which TLS cipher suites to use. This policy does not affect QUIC-based connections.

TabFreezingEnabled.title: Allow freezing of background tabs
TabFreezingEnabled.description: Controls whether Microsoft Edge can freeze tabs that are in the background for at least 5 minutes.

TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.title: Enable ending processes in Task Manager
TaskManagerEndProcessEnabled.description: If set to false, the 'End process' button is disabled in the Task Manager.

TotalMemoryLimitMb.title: Set limit on megabytes of memory a single Microsoft Edge instance can use.
TotalMemoryLimitMb.description: Configures the amount of memory that a single Microsoft Edge instance can use before tabs start getting discarded to save memory. The memory used by the tab will be freed and the tab will have to be reloaded when switched to.

TrackingPrevention.title: Tracking Prevention
TrackingPrevention.description: Block tracking of users' web-browsing activity

enum_titles: Basic (blocks harmful trackers, content and ads will be personalized)
Balanced (blocks harmful trackers and trackers from sites user has not visited; content and ads will be less personalized)
Strict (blocks harmful trackers and majority of trackers from all sites; content and ads will have minimal personalization. Some parts of sites might not work)

TranslateEnabled.title: Enable Translate
TranslateEnabled.description: Enables the integrated Microsoft translation service on Microsoft Edge.

URLBlocklist.title: Block access to a list of URLs
URLBlocklist.description: Define a list of sites, based on URL patterns, that are blocked (your users can't load them). Format the URL pattern according to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.title: Enable User-Agent Client Hints
UserAgentClientHintsEnabled.description: Enable the User-Agent Client Hints feature.

URLAllowlist.title: Allow access to a list of URLs
URLAllowlist.description: Allow access to the listed URLs, as exceptions to the URL denylist. Format the URL pattern according to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095322.

UserFeedbackAllowed.title: Allow user feedback
UserFeedbackAllowed.description: Allow user feedback. If the policy is set to false, users can not send feedback to Microsoft.

UserDataDir.title: Set user data directory
UserDataDir.description: Configures the directory that Microsoft Edge will use for storing user data. See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2095041 for a list of variables that can be used.

VideoCaptureAllowed.title: Allow or deny video capture
VideoCaptureAllowed.description:
If enabled or not configured (default), the user will be prompted for
video capture access except for URLs configured in the VideoCaptureAllowedUrls list which will be granted access without prompting.

VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.title: URLs that will be granted access to video capture devices without prompt
VideoCaptureAllowedUrls.description:
Patterns in this list will be matched against the security
origin of the requesting URL.  If a match is found, access to audio
capture devices will be granted without prompt.

WPADQuickCheckEnabled.title: Enable WPAD optimization
WPADQuickCheckEnabled.description: Allows you to turn off WPAD (Web Proxy Auto-Discovery) optimization in Microsoft Edge

WebAppInstallForceList.title: WebApp Force Install List
WebAppInstallForceList.description: Specifies a list of websites that are installed silently, without user interaction, and which cannot be uninstalled nor disabled by the user.

WebComponentsV0Enabled.description: Re-enable Web Components v0 API until M84.

WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.title: Allow WebDriver to Override Incompatible Policies
WebDriverOverridesIncompatiblePolicies.description: This policy allows users of the WebDriver feature to override policies which can interfere with its operation. This policy is deprecated. It is currently supported but will become obsolete in a future release.

WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls.description: Manage exposure of local IP addressess by WebRTC

WebRtcLocalhostIpHandling.description: Manage exposure of local IP addressess by WebRTC

enum_titles: Allow public and private interfaces over http default route
Allow public interface over http default route, but don't expose local IP
Use TCP unless proxy server supports UDP and don't expose local IP

WebRtcUdpPortRange.title: Restrict the range of local UDP ports used by WebRTC
WebRtcUdpPortRange.description: If the policy is set, the UDP port range used by WebRTC is restricted to the specified port interval (endpoints included).

NativeMessagingBlocklist.title: Names of the forbidden native messaging hosts (or * for all)
NativeMessagingBlocklist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts that should not be loaded. A denylist value of '*' means all native messaging hosts are on the denylist unless they are explicitly listed in the allowlist.

NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.title: Allow user-level Native Messaging hosts (installed without admin permissions)
NativeMessagingUserLevelHosts.description: Enables user-level installation of Native Messaging hosts.

NativeMessagingAllowlist.title: Native Messaging Host Denylist
NativeMessagingAllowlist.description: Allows you to specify which native messaging hosts are not subject to the denylist. A denylist value of * means all native messaging hosts are on the denylist and only native messaging hosts listed in the allowlist will be loaded.

PasswordManagerEnabled.title: Enable saving passwords to the password manager
PasswordManagerEnabled.description: If this setting is enabled, users can have Microsoft Edge memorize passwords and provide them automatically the next time they log in to a site.

PasswordMonitorAllowed.title: Allow Password Monitor
PasswordMonitorAllowed.description: Allow Microsoft Edge to monitor user passwords.

DefaultPrinterSelection.title: Default printer selection rules
DefaultPrinterSelection.description: Overrides Microsoft Edge default printer selection rules.

PrintHeaderFooter.title: Print Headers & Footers
PrintHeaderFooter.description: Force 'headers and footers' to be on or off in the printing dialog.

PrintingEnabled.title: Enable printing
PrintingEnabled.description: Enables printing in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing this setting.

UseSystemPrintDialog.title: Print using system print dialog
UseSystemPrintDialog.description: If you enable this policy, Microsoft Edge opens the system print dialog instead of the built-in print preview when a user prints a page.

PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.title: Use System Default Printer as Default
PrintPreviewUseSystemDefaultPrinter.description: Causes Microsoft Edge to use the system default printer as the default choice in Print Preview instead of the most recently used printer.

ProxyBypassList.title: Comma-separated list of proxy bypass rules
ProxyBypassList.description: Microsoft Edge will bypass any proxy for the list of hosts given here.

ProxyMode.title: Choose how to specify proxy server settings
ProxyMode.description: Allows you to specify the proxy server used by Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing proxy settings.

ProxyPacUrl.title: URL to a proxy .pac file
ProxyPacUrl.description: You can specify a URL to a proxy .pac file here.

ProxyServer.title: Address or URL of proxy server
ProxyServer.description: You can specify the URL of the proxy server here.

ProxyServerMode.title: Proxy server settings
ProxyServerMode.description: Configures the proxy settings for Microsoft Edge.

PreventSmartScreenPromptOverride.title: Prevent SmartScreen prompt override
PreventSmartScreenPromptOverride.description: Lets you decide whether users can override the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about potentially malicious websites.

PreventSmartScreenPromptOverrideForFiles.title: Prevent SmartScreen prompt override for files
PreventSmartScreenPromptOverrideForFiles.description: Lets you determine whether users can override Microsoft Defender SmartScreen warnings about unverified downloads.

SmartScreenAllowListDomains.title: Prevent SmartScreen prompt override for files
SmartScreenAllowListDomains.description: Configure the list of domains for which Microsoft Defender SmartScreen won't trigger warnings.

SmartScreenForTrustedDownloadsEnabled.title: Enable SmartScreen Trusted Downloads
SmartScreenForTrustedDownloadsEnabled.description: Force Microsoft Defender SmartScreen checks on downloads from trusted sources

SmartScreenPuaEnabled.title: Enable SmartScreen potentially unwanted apps
SmartScreenPuaEnabled.description: Configure Microsoft Defender SmartScreen to block potentially unwanted apps

PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.title: Change password URL
PasswordProtectionChangePasswordURL.description: Configure the change password URL (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only). Password protection service will send users to this URL to change their password after seeing a warning in the browser.

PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.title: Enterprise login URLs
PasswordProtectionLoginURLs.description: Configure the list of enterprise login URLs (HTTP and HTTPS schemes only) where Microsoft Edge should capture the salted hashes of passwords and use it for password reuse detection.

PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.title: Password protection warning trigger
PasswordProtectionWarningTrigger.description: Allows you to control the triggering of passwore protection warning. Password protection alerts users when they reuse their protected password on potentially suspicious sites.

enum_titles: Password protection warning is triggered by password reuse
Password protection warning is triggered by password reuse on phishing page

HomepageIsNewTabPage.title: Use New Tab Page as homepage
HomepageIsNewTabPage.description: Configures the type of the default home page in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing home page preferences. The home page can either be set to a URL you specify or set to the New Tab Page.

HomepageLocation.title: Home page URL
HomepageLocation.description: Configures the default home page URL in Microsoft Edge and prevents users from changing it.

NewTabPageAllowedBackgroundTypes.title: New Tab Page Allowed Background Types
NewTabPageAllowedBackgroundTypes.description: Configures the background types allowed for the new tab page layout.

NewTabPageCompanyLogo.title: New Tab Page Company Logo
NewTabPageCompanyLogo.description: Set new tab page company logo. The logo must be in PNG or SVG format, and its file size must not exceed 16 MB. For help with determining the SHA-256 hash, see https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/get-filehash.

NewTabPageHideDefaultTopSites.title: Hide the default top sites from the new tab page
NewTabPageHideDefaultTopSites.description: Hides the default top sites from the new tab page in Microsoft Edge.

NewTabPageLocation.title: New Tab page URL
NewTabPageLocation.description: Configures the default New Tab page URL and prevents users from changing it.

NewTabPageManagedQuickLinks.title: New Tab page managed quick links
NewTabPageManagedQuickLinks.description: Set new tab page managed quick links

NewTabPageSetFeedType.title: New Tab Page Feed Type
NewTabPageSetFeedType.description: Configure the Microsoft Edge new tab page experience

RestoreOnStartup.title: Action on startup
RestoreOnStartup.description: Allows you to specify the behavior on startup.

RestoreOnStartupURLs.title: URLs to open on startup
RestoreOnStartupURLs.description: If 'Open a list of URLs' is selected as the startup action, this allows you to specify the list of URLs that are opened. If left not set no URL will be opened on start up.

ShowHomeButton.title: Show Home button on toolbar
ShowHomeButton.description: Shows the Home button on Microsoft Edge's toolbar.

WebUsbAskForUrls.title: Allow WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbAskForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are allowed to ask the user to grant them access to a USB device.

WebUsbBlockedForUrls.title: Block WebUSB on these sites
WebUsbBlockedForUrls.description: Allows you to set a list of url patterns that specify sites which are prevented from asking the user to grant them access to a USB device.
